drivers: Strong EPYC and MI350 series sales

segments.name: Data Center
key_points: Driven by MI350 series ramp and EPYC Turin adoption
Server CPU revenue reached all-time high
More than 160 new EPYC instances launched by hyperscalers

segments.name: Client and Gaming

client.context: Record Ryzen sales, rich product mix

gaming.context: Higher semi-custom revenue, strong Radeon demand

key_points: Desktop CPU sales reached all-time high
Commercial momentum accelerated with 30%+ sell-through growth

segments.name: Embedded
key_points: Revenue up 4% sequentially as demand strengthened
Expanded portfolio with Ryzen Embedded 9000 series
On track for second straight year of record design wins

gross_margin.context: Up 40 basis points year-over-year driven by mix

expectations.revenue_context: Represents ~25% YoY growth. Driven by double-digit growth in Data Center and Client/Gaming.
expectations.notes: Does not include any revenue from MI308 shipments to China.

partnerships.name: OpenAI
partnerships.details: Deployment of 6 gigawatts of Instinct GPUs. First gigawatt of MI450 in 2H 2026.

partnerships.name: Oracle
partnerships.details: First hyperscaler to offer MI355X instances. Deploying MI450 in 2026.

regulatory.impact: Received some licenses for MI308, but no revenue included in Q4 guidance.
